_header: Though ye my love were near a lady fair
_description: Farewell to a false love — three quatrains with a four-line burden: ‘Lost ys my love farewell adewe…’

BodAsh176.First Lines:
Though ye my love were were (sic) a ladye fayrpassing all other in
                    bewtye to ensure…
BodAsh176.Last Lines:
…except I knowe a better assurancenay my Love nay farewell
                    adewe
BodAsh176.Editions:
Wagner,  B. M. 
             “New Songs of the Reign of Henry VIII.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         50 (1935): 452-55: 453.
